content: square chain 3 3 double crochets down same post skip next 3 double crochets ** repeat from ** to ** across row row 10-12 work increase row on even row and decrease row on odd row for an afghan continue progressing alternating between an increase row and a decrease row until the work is as long as you want it a good baby blanket length is 36 inches row 13-18 work decrease row each row to close up the rectangle upon making the last square chain 3 turn skip next 3 double crochets and slip_stitch down post of next chain 3 this evens up the end of the afghan ~don t forget - if you get confused you can look at the tutorial below ©2000 corner start stitch photo tutorial - for use with written pattern also called diagonal crochet stitch photos & directions copyright 2001 row 1 square 1 - chain 6 skip first three chains double_crochet in 4th 5th & 6th chain from hook this completes the first square and the first row row 2 - chain 6 skip first three chains double_crochet in 4th 5th & 6th chain from hook increase made flip up first square skip three dcs of first square slip_stitch around the chain 3 post of the 1st sq chain 3 3 double_crochet down same post that completes the 2nd row row 3 - chain 6 double_crochet into 4th 5th & 6th chain from hook turn work note do you notice how the *chain 6 double_crochet in 4th 5th 6th chain from hk* series creates an *increase square* on that row this is considered an *increase row* because you are increasing one square at the beginning of each row skip next three dcs slip_stitch around chain 3 post of next square **chain 3 3 double_crochet down same post skip next three dcs slip_stitch around chain 3 post of next square ** repeat ** to ** of above square across each row row 4- - repeat row 3 increase row until work is as wide as required to continue working in *length* while maintaining the same width - you need to do a decrease row called that because you are not increasing one square at the beginning of each row decrease row - chain 3 skip next 3 dcs slip_stitch around the chain 3 post of previous row s first square chain 3 3 double_crochet down post skip next three dcs slip_stitch around chain 3 post of next square **chain 3 3 double_crochet down same post skip next three dcs slip_stitch around chain 3 post of next square ** row - finish - continue by alternating between *increase row* to make the rectangle taller but now wider and *decrease row* which will maintain the width until you close up the afghan with the last square after finishing last square - chain 3 turn and slip_stitch around chain 3 post of previous row this will even out the sides of the afghan sample this stitch looks
